alert.note: Alert for Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 5:19PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF ROAN AND TAVAPUTS PLATEAUS... FLAT TOPS...LOWER YAMPA RIVER BASIN...CENTRAL YAMPA RIVER BASIN...AND TAVAPUTS PLATEAU COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 517 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Dinosaur to 11 miles south of Rangely and moving northeast at 50 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Rangely, Dinosaur, Elk Springs, Blue Mountain, Sunbeam, Maybell, Artesia and Massadona. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 2 and 63. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 4, and between mile markers 7 and 58. Colorado 139 between mile markers 50 and 72. Colorado 318 between mile markers 47 and 60. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
